III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the
ability, experience, education, and training to perform the
duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation On 9/21/23, foster care worker went into a youth's placement and
pushed the youth into a window in their bedroom when the door
was closed.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by telephone on 09/27/2023.
Complainant stated Youth A had reported the allegation to other
agency staff members. Complainant stated Youth A alleged the
incident occurred on 9/21/2023 when Foster Care Worker 1 visited
the foster home of Youth A. Complainant stated the foster parents
did not hear anything related to the allegations. Complainant
stated Foster Care Worker 1 was subsequently suspended
pending the outcome of the agency's investigation. Complainant
stated Youth A was upset at the time of the alleged incident, was
flipping tables and chairs and was sent to the hospital where
Youth A spent the night in the emergency room. Complainant
described Youth A as not having any injuries but was emotionally
out of control leading to the trip to the hospital. Complainant
stated Foster Care Worker 1 does not have any history of
disciplinary action or of any trouble working with youth on Foster
Care Workers caseload.
I participated in a Placement Collaboration Unit (PCU) video
conference on 10/04/2023. Others involved in this conference
were the current foster care worker, adoption worker, adoption
supervisor, complainant, and the DHHS monitor for Youth A.
Foster Care Worker 2 reported that at the time of the alleged
incident Youth A was struggling to maintain his current placement
and Foster Care Worker 1 was attempting to motivate Youth A by
telling Youth A that a change in placement could result in a
change he would not like. Foster Care Worker 2 described Youth
A as tipping over chairs and tables and being taken for an
evaluation. Foster Care Worker 2 stated Youth A was taken to the
hospital that day and spent the night but was not admitted before
being returned to the foster home. Foster Care Worker 2 stated
Youth A is continuing to have behavioral issues but is in the
process of having a medication review and a safety plan is being
put in place.
During the PCU conference none of the participants expressed a
concern that Foster Care Worker 1 may have pushed Youth A as
alleged by Youth A.
I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by telephone on 11/02/2023. Foster
Parent 1 was the foster parent for Youth A at the time of the
alleged incident and she reported Youth A is still a foster child in
their home. Foster Parent 1 reported they did not hear or see
2

anything to substantiate the allegations. Foster Parent 1 stated
Youth A later recanted the allegations and said Youth A told them
he made it up because Youth A was mad at Foster Care Worker 1
at the time.
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 11/02/2023. Youth A
admitted he made up the allegations because he was mad at
Foster Care Worker 1 at the time. Youth A apologized for making
up the story.
Analysis The findings of this investigation did not provide any evidence to
support the allegation that Foster Care Worker 1 pushed Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
